item.title: Artist At The Center Of Marathon‚Äôs Plagiarism Scandal Says Bungie Has Made Things Right
item.content:encoded:
Earlier this year, Bungie found itself in the center of an unexpectedplagiarism scandal. The studio‚Äôs upcoming extraction shooter, Marathon, was found to have included work lifted from online artist Antireal without her knowledge or consent. Bungie fessed up and apologized, claiming it was an accident.

Now, five months after the controversy, the artist, Antireal, has posted on X stating that the ‚ÄúMarathon art issue has been resolved with Bungie and Sony Interactive Entertainment to my satisfaction.‚Äù

The Marathon art issue has been resolved with Bungie and Sony Interactive Entertainment to my satisfaction.

‚Äî N¬≤ (@4nt1r34l) December 2, 2025

This comes after a few months of silence from both parties. Bungie placed blame on a former employee and stated it would conduct a review of all of its assets to make sure it wouldn‚Äôt happen again.

Antireal hasn‚Äôt shared the details of what was involved in the resolution, but as her post indicates, she appears to be happy with how it all shaked out.

Marathon‚Äôs early previews, meanwhile, haven‚Äôt been entirely positive. The hero-based extraction shooter has failed to impress fans of the studio and the genre broadly speaking. Still, the gorgeous aesthetic at work in the game‚Äôs art was one of the shooter‚Äôs highlights. That was all thrown into chaos after the plagiarism revelations.

The developer recently conducted some private tests for the shooter, but a release date is still nowhere to be found following the game‚Äôs delay earlier this year. Sony has claimed Marathon will launch before April 2026.

item.title: Goldfish That Took Down One Of Elden Ring‚Äòs Toughest Bosses Has Died
item.content:encoded:
Clair Obscur: Expedition 33‚Äòs European concert is selling out in record time. Megabonk is back in the running for The Game Awards. Also RIP to the fish that did what many players couldn‚Äôt. It‚Äôs the latest edition of Morning Checkpoint, Kotaku‚Äòs daily roundup of gaming news and culture. Rockstar Games cofounder Dan Houser likened AI hype to ‚ÄúMad Cow disease.‚Äù Every game store should add that as a disclaimer: this game was made using generative AI tools. It might slop-ify your brain as a result. Play at your own peril.

The goldfish beat Malenia but couldn‚Äôt overcome a systemic bacterial infection

Tortellini, the viral goldfish that played Elden Ring and other games using a motion censor in its fish tank, has died at the age of three (via Dexerto). The pet‚Äôs owner, YouTuber Pointcrow, said the goldfish had spent weeks battling an infection, and things took a turn for the worse over Thanksgiving week.

Unfortunately, my goldfish Tortellini has passed away.

He's been unwell for the past couple weeks fighting a systemic bacterial infection, and took a turn for the worse last night. I'm doing my best as a goldfish keeper, but fancies are incredibly fragile, and it seems that‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/2ovsZItz8v

‚Äî eric pointcrow (@PointCrow) November 27, 2025

‚ÄúNot only was he one of the only goldfish to play video games, he defeated some of the hardest bosses in Elden Ring‚ÄìMalenia and Consort Radahn to name a few. He was a big spender, notably buying an Oil Cooler Inlet Pipe for a Nissan Altima and TWO designer bags,‚Äù he wrote in a tribute posted last week. ‚ÄúHe was there to make us all laugh and bewilder us on how a small fish could do so much. He‚Äôs lived a god damn good life. I miss him so much. I‚Äôm sure he‚Äôs swimming in the great tank in the sky right now as happy as he can be.‚Äù

Someone finally escaped from Escape from Tarkov

A streamer who goes by Tigz has spent years playing the extraction shooter in Early Access, but was finally able to complete its last mission now that the game recently went 1.0 (via Insider Gaming). Unlocking the ending required a harrowing playthrough of the new map Terminal, but Tigz reportedly only got the second-worst ending out of four. While he‚Äôs the first player to officially ‚Äúbeat‚Äù the game, someone else out there still has the chance to be the first to unlock Tarkov‚Äòs best ending.

Megabonk still has a shot at winning The Game Awards

While the game‚Äôs creator took the unprecedented step of removing Megabonk‚Äòs nomination for best debut indie game since he said he‚Äôd shipped other things in the past, it‚Äôs back in the player‚Äôs choice category. It‚Äôll have to pass successive rounds of voting to make it into the finals. ‚ÄúI withdrew my other nomination due to Megabonk not fitting the category, but with this new nomination, we‚Äôre more back than ever. go vote pls,‚Äù Vedinad wrote on X this week.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 concert tickets are gaming‚Äôs hottest new collectibles

Within a minute they‚Äôre all gone for London! Please add more dates! pic.twitter.com/eTUmWNIRwU

‚Äî Totally Not A Walrus (@TotallyNoWalrus) December 2, 2025

Tickets went on sale for the A Painted Symphony tour earlier today and are already nearly sold out everywhere (via The Gamer). Only a few locations, Bordeaux, Strasbourg, and Strasbourg, still have tickets available. Fans said seats for the concert in the biggest cities like London evaporated immediately. I guess players are into video game concerts after all, but only ones with great music.

Ball X Pit is getting a bunch of free DLC

2025‚Äôs hit indie dopamine machine will be giving fans more balls and more pits in early 2026. Publisher Devolver Digital revealed the game has now sold over 1 million copies and has a post-release roadmap. An update titled Regal arrives in January, one called Shadow arrives in April, and one called Natrulaist arrives in July. They‚Äôll all be free and add new balls, evolutions, buildings, characters, ‚ÄúAND MORE.‚Äù I guess the arcade roguelike is going to steal a good portion of my game time next year as well.

The architect of the PS5 is in love with Pikmin

Mark Cerny revealed the Nintendo exclusive was one of his favorite games in a recent interview on Simon Parkin‚Äôs My Perfect Console (via NintendoLife). ‚ÄúI had this thing where I tended to play smaller, lighter games for about 10 years, so I don‚Äôt know, Portal or Plants vs Zombies or Flower or Katamari Damacy,‚Äù the Marble Madness creator said. ‚ÄúPikmin I just pick out of that list because I thought it was such an emotionally involving story. Poor Captain Olimar, he crash lands and he‚Äôs got 30 days to reassemble his ship or he‚Äôll run out of oxygen and die and he‚Äôs sending letters home every day.‚Äù

item.title: Europa Universalis V patch 1.0.8 makes the Aztecs a bit more advanced
item.content:encoded:
Paradox Tinto has remained busy after the release of Europa Universalis V last month, pushing out a clutch of patches and with a testing regime for upcoming changes. The tail end of November was all about the 1.0.8 beta patches, and now those improvements have gone live for the main development path, bringing hundreds of bug fixes, and some nice new tweaks and features.

On a high level, the patch brings eight new advances for the Aztec formable country, six new advances for the Two Sicilies formables, one more Tenochtitlan advance, and two more Sicilian and Neapolitan advances that can also be unlocked.

If you don‚Äôt happen to be playing as or angling for any of those countries to be formed, then there‚Äôs still some save game optimisation, a new combat tooltip that might help newcomers, and over 320 bugs fixed.

Here‚Äôs the full patch notes:

New Features

  • Added 8 new advances for the Aztec formable
